trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> class defines the algorithm used for a cryptographic operation.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> class by using a set of default parameters.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier> class has the following default property values.
Property
Default value
The maximum provided by the default Cryptographic Service Provider

To gain the highest degree of control over an application constructing an instance of this class, use one of the constructors that allows the algorithm to be set by passing in its <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object.
This guards against the possibility that the default algorithm could change because of security or other considerations.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Oid)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> class with the specified algorithm identifier.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.%23ctor>.
An object identifier for the algorithm.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Oid,System.Int32)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> class with the specified algorithm identifier and key length.
The `keyLength` parameter is ignored for algorithms that use a fixed key length.
An object identifier for the algorithm.
The length, in bits, of the key.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.KeyLength"></xref> property sets or retrieves the key length, in bits.
This property is not used for algorithms that use a fixed key length.
Due to a limitation in the ASN.1 encoding of the key length, the value of this property is estimated for the RC4 encryption algorithm; it is not guaranteed to be accurate.
An int value that represents the key length, in bits.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.Oid"></xref> property sets or retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object that specifies the object identifier for the algorithm.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object that represents the algorithm.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier.Parameters"></xref> property sets or retrieves any parameters required by the algorithm.
An array of byte values that specifies any parameters required by the algorithm.
